alert.note: Alert for Brunswick; Dinwiddie; Greensville; Lunenburg; Mecklenburg; Nottoway; Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 26 at 11:37PM EDT until June 27 at 12:15AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... North central Greensville County in southeastern Virginia... Northeastern Mecklenburg County in south central Virginia... Southeastern Lunenburg County in south central Virginia... Southeastern Nottoway County in south central Virginia... West central Sussex County in southeastern Virginia... Southern Dinwiddie County in south central Virginia... Northern Brunswick County in south central Virginia... * Until 1215 AM EDT. * At 1137 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Dundas, or near Kenbridge, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Alberta and Fort Barfoot around 1145 PM EDT. McKenney around 1205 AM EDT. Dewitt around 1210 AM EDT. Dinwiddie around 1215 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Bacons Fork, Cochran, Irby, Wilburn, Gills Corner, Dolphin, Murdocks, Forkland, Wharfs Store and Meredithville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA.

area.areaDesc: Brunswick; Dinwiddie; Greensville; Lunenburg; Mecklenburg; Nottoway; Sussex
